categories.description: I am the Lord your God. You shall not have strange gods before me.

sins.question: Have I neglected prayer or treated it as unimportant?
sins.details: Regular prayer is essential for spiritual growth and maintaining a relationship with God.

sins.question: Have I doubted or denied the truths of the faith?
sins.details: Deliberately rejecting Church teachings or dogmas is a serious offense against faith.

sins.question: Have I been involved in superstition, fortune-telling, horoscopes, occult practices, witchcraft, or New Age rituals?
sins.details: These practices demonstrate a lack of trust in God's providence and can open one to spiritual deception.

sins.question: Have I despaired of God's mercy or presumed upon it without repentance?
sins.details: Both despair and presumption distort our understanding of God's mercy and justice.

sins.question: Have I put trust in myself, wealth, popularity, or created things more than in God?
sins.details: Placing ultimate trust in created things rather than God is a form of idolatry.

categories.description: You shall not take the name of the Lord your God in vain.

sins.question: Have I used God's name carelessly, irreverently, or in anger?
sins.details: Using God's name without respect shows a lack of reverence for His holiness.

sins.question: Have I spoken blasphemy against God, the Church, or holy things?
sins.details: Blasphemy is a direct offense against God's honor and dignity.

sins.question: Have I made false oaths or broken promises made in God's name?
sins.details: Taking false oaths or breaking sworn promises involves God in falsehood.

categories.description: Remember to keep holy the Lord's Day.

sins.question: Have I deliberately missed Mass on Sundays or Holy Days of Obligation without a serious reason?
sins.details: The Sunday obligation is a serious duty that binds under pain of mortal sin.

sins.question: Have I done unnecessary servile work on Sunday that prevented worship or rest?
sins.details: Sunday should be kept free from work that hinders worship and proper relaxation.

sins.question: Have I failed to sanctify the day through prayer, reading Scripture, or works of mercy?
sins.details: Sunday should be a day dedicated to spiritual growth and charitable works.

categories.description: Honor your father and your mother.

sins.question: Have I disobeyed, disrespected, or neglected my parents?
sins.details: Children owe their parents respect, gratitude, and reasonable obedience.

sins.question: Have I failed to care for aging parents?
sins.details: Adult children have a duty to support their parents in old age and illness.

sins.question: Have I disobeyed legitimate authority when it was just?
sins.details: We have a duty to respect and obey legitimate authority within its proper sphere.

sins.question: Have I failed to support and honor family members?
sins.details: Family members should support one another materially and spiritually.

sins.question: Have I harbored hatred, anger, or resentment?
sins.details: Deliberately nurturing hatred is contrary to charity and can lead to more serious sins.

sins.question: Have I injured others physically or emotionally?
sins.details: Causing deliberate harm to others violates their human dignity.

sins.question: Have I participated in, supported, or encouraged abortion, euthanasia, or assisted suicide?
sins.details: Direct participation in or support of the taking of innocent human life is gravely sinful.

sins.question: Have I abused alcohol, drugs, or food in a way that harms health?
sins.details: We have a duty to care for our health as a gift from God.

sins.question: Have I failed to care for my own health or that of others?
sins.details: We are stewards of our health and have a responsibility to care for others.

sins.question: Have I engaged in sexual activity outside of marriage?
sins.details: Sexual activity is reserved for marriage; any deliberate sexual activity outside marriage is gravely sinful.

sins.question: Have I masturbated?
sins.details: Deliberate self-stimulation for sexual pleasure is gravely contrary to chastity and the dignity of the body.

sins.question: Have I viewed pornography or deliberately sought out impure content?
sins.details: Pornography violates chastity and human dignity, treating persons as objects for pleasure.

sins.question: Have I deliberately entertained lustful thoughts?
sins.details: Willfully dwelling on impure thoughts violates interior chastity.

sins.question: Have I engaged in flirtation or relationships that tempt to sin?
sins.details: We must avoid occasions that could lead to sins against chastity.

sins.question: Have I dressed immodestly or encouraged others to sin?
sins.details: Modesty protects the dignity of persons and their capacity for love.

sins.question: Have I used contraception or sterilization to prevent conception?
sins.details: Deliberately frustrating the procreative nature of the marital act is gravely sinful.

sins.question: Have I taken what is not mine?
sins.details: Theft violates justice and the right to private property.

sins.question: Have I cheated in school, business, or games?
sins.details: Cheating violates justice and truth in human relationships.

sins.question: Have I failed to pay debts or just wages?
sins.details: Withholding just wages or failing to pay debts is a serious violation of justice.

sins.question: Have I wasted or misused others' time, property, or resources?
sins.details: We must respect and use responsibly what belongs to others.

categories.description: You shall not bear false witness.

sins.question: Have I lied or been deceitful?
sins.details: Lying damages truth and trust in human relationships.

sins.question: Have I spoken badly of others without reason (detraction)?
sins.details: Revealing others' faults without just cause damages their reputation.

sins.question: Have I spread gossip or rumors?
sins.details: Spreading harmful information, even if true, can violate charity.

sins.question: Have I damaged someone's reputation?
sins.details: Calumny - speaking falsehood to harm reputation - is gravely sinful.

sins.question: Have I failed to defend someone's good name when I could?
sins.details: We have a duty to defend the reputation of others when possible.

categories.description: You shall not covet your neighbor's wife.

sins.question: Have I entertained sexual desire for someone not my spouse?
sins.details: Deliberately entertaining lustful thoughts violates interior chastity.

sins.question: Have I deliberately looked at impure images or situations?
sins.details: Seeking out occasions of sexual temptation is a sin against purity.

sins.question: Have I been unfaithful in my heart or imagination?
sins.details: Mental infidelity violates marital fidelity and chastity.

categories.description: You shall not covet your neighbor's goods.

sins.question: Have I been jealous of another's possessions, success, or talents?
sins.details: Envy and greed damage our relationship with God and neighbor.

sins.question: Have I resented the good fortune of others?
sins.details: Sadness at others' good fortune is contrary to charity.

sins.question: Have I been dissatisfied with my own blessings?
sins.details: Ingratitude for God's gifts shows a lack of trust in divine providence.

categories.description: The minimum requirements for practicing the faith.

sins.question: Have I failed to attend Mass on Sundays/Holy Days?
sins.details: Missing Mass without serious reason is a grave sin.

sins.question: Have I neglected confession at least once a year?
sins.details: Annual confession of serious sins is a minimum requirement for Catholics.

sins.question: Have I failed to receive Holy Communion during Easter Season?
sins.details: The Easter duty is a fundamental obligation of Catholic life.

sins.question: Have I neglected to fast and abstain on required days?
sins.details: Fasting and abstinence are important practices of penance.

sins.question: Have I failed to support the Church financially when able?
sins.details: Supporting the Church's material needs is a duty according to one's means.
